Reviews.Title: “So very excellent”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyFlanagan
Reviews.Content: Most effortless cool hotel room I've seen in my life. And comfortable. And conveniently located. The staff were friendly and helpful, thoughtful of any needs I might have and always greeting me kindly. There's a tapas and cocktail bar downstairs, which makes for the ultimate commute to bed after a couple of cold ones. Delighted with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Young and quirky hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen X
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in this hotel and enjoyed every moment. The room was fresh and clean with a large, comfortable bed and a balcony overlooking the street and rooftops of the old city. The area was a popular night spot for restaurants and bars, but we were not disturbed by the sound of voices in the street as most people had left the area by midnight. The hotel itself served great food and cocktails downstairs in the bar / restaurant and the bar also served as the reception area. The staff were very helpful and made every effort to ensure that our questions were answered and requests were met. One thing, we only saw one room, but would advise that you need to be very comfortable with your partner's toilet habits as the frosted glass partition in the shower/ toilet area didn't afford much priivacy! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tommy_P15
Reviews.Content: Myself and 7 of my friends stayed in dragon a few weeks ago. Really cool hotel, very central, and rooms are very interesting. Because we had a big crowd we got a good chance to nose about the bedrooms and we really got to see how different each one was. Room 3 with the glass floor looking on to the ruins of city wall is really cool. Finally, staff were very really friendly and helpful. I had trouble printing my boarding pass for my flight home and one of the staff helped me out (big thanks once again). Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: PICANTO
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from 5 days at this gem of a hotel. The location is great, only 5 mins walk to the plaza mayor passing some of the best tapas bars in Madrid. The food in the hotel is first class we tried various types if food at different times of the day, there was always a great vibe. The room was retro boutique style and was amazing, always clean every day and the air con was very welcome after a day in the heat. Our daughter and her husband came with us whilst visiting from Australia and they agree with everything we say. We didn't get the name of the female receptionist but she was one of the friendliest ones we have ever dealt with and we have dealt with many. We got a taxi to and from the airport it was 35 euros to the hotel and 45 euros on the return. This was more than the metro would have been but our daughter is 6 months pregnant and this was a better mode of travel. All in all an amazing 5 days in Madrid made all the better by a perfectly located and great hotel, we will stay here again when we return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, clean, very friendly, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dan O
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here - we booked for two nights in the neighbouring, sister hotel Posada del Leon de Oro but a minor itinerary error (mine) meant we needed another two nights in Madrid. Leon de Oro was booked up but a quick run next door by the super friendly reception guy and we sorted at Dragon. Great first impression. At Dragon, there's a cool cocktail/tapas bar and restaurant downstairs, gets very busy at night but yet the noise upstairs is really very well attenuated. Rooms are not quite as spacious as at Leon de Oro, but the pricing reflects this. In any case, the rooms are bright, clean and comfortable, funky decor and if we're honest, we preferred Dragon to Leon de Oro though there wasn't much in it - a personal call. Location is perfect for exploring La Latina and Plaza Mayor area. Easily walkable to Peurta del Sol and Chueca, we even walked via Gran Via to Salamanca but La Latina metro station is just around the corner so that's another option. All together a top job.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Zippydedoodah
Reviews.Content: Posada del Dragon has it all. Top Location in a really cool barrio. Really friendly staff. Very comfy beds and a really cool modern bedroom. The food in the bar downstairs is good too, and they pour an excellent beer. Oh yes and a room with a view if you get a balcony. Powerful shower, nice products. Can't think of a downside at all. B.R.I.L.L.I.A.N.T.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: miketopgun
Reviews.Content: The Posada Dragon hotel is very nice and clean modern hotel. Just a couple of blocks (2) from Plaza Mayor. Maria, Luis and Jose were great customer service rep's that provided me with all the information I needed for a good time in Madrid. The AC in the hotel works very well and there will be no issues for those traveling in summer. The night life in madrid near the hotels is what it is. The night life starts late through the night. Sunset in Madrid is around 10 pm

Reviews.Title: “Our Posada in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sherrieseg
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Madrid for almost a week at La Posada del Dragon. My husband and I stayed in room 303 which was well appointed, comfortable space, fairly quiet and with a great view. I had selected the hotel based on the location near the Plaza Mayor, price, and the reviews and ratings. The staff were friendly and supportive, most spoke English. We were able to access the free wi-fi and enjoyed the breakfast buffet at a reduced rate. The location was great, adjacent to many wonderful restaurants, bars, shops, and metro stations. The only issues were with the air conditioning that a couple of times shut down because of a glitch with another room. We also missed the use of a business center although the staff were quite willing to search for any information including tours and weather conditions. We would highly recommend this hotel to travellers who are looking for a great experience for good value.

Reviews.Title: “quirky retreat”
Reviews.Author: tinamryan
Reviews.Content: Excellent postion in Old Madrid. Room quite small but had majority of holiday requirements. A long mirror would be good, as would mirror over dressing table - not that we're vain but it's nice to see how we look before venturing into Madrid nightlife. Shower excellent and lovely toiletries readily provided. Clothes rail a little high and more hangers please as no drawers to put clothes in - this meant using suitcases to store undies etc and as room on small side meant we had to be very organised! Our room had no outside windows but air-con superb and we consequently had no disruption from street noise. Lovely breakfast (12 euros). All the staff were very helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. Highly recommend this place to stay and also highly recommend whole surrounding area for eating / shopping and general site seeing. The Market at night is a must:)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Londonyoungsara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Posada del dragon for 3 nights in May and absolutely loved it. The location is ideal - right on the old town on a great street with lots of 'locals' restaurants and bars. The hotel itself is also amazing - downstairs is a great tapas bar and the rooms are small but all you need, very clean and comfortable with great showers.

Reviews.Title: “Would be very happy to stay again”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great hotel. The location is convenient next to lots of busy bars and restaurants, and there are lots of other travellers nearby. My room had a balcony from which you could see the roof of the cathedral which was nice. The staff were very friendly even when they were rushed off their feet, and very tolerant of my rubbish Spanish. The bar was nice and convenient as you could go there and plan your day at breakfast or in the early evening using the free wifi. If you like Belgian-style beer then I recommend having one of their Cibeles Morena beers which tastes nice and is made in Madrid too. The room was a decent size and had a safe, a great shower and toiletries including a body lotion which comes in handy for the inevitable sunburn. Special mention should be given to the cleaners - the bedsheets were the whitest I have ever seen, they were dazzlingly white! Overall I thought this was a great hotel and good value. If you do stay I recommend checking out the photos on Google Street View as these are from before the hotel was done up, so you can see what a big change they made.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique”
Reviews.Author: SallyOday
Reviews.Content: We were intent on staying somehwere central and so booked our hotel on that basis. Arrival was a little confusing as you see the name of the hotel but no hotel, just a bar of some sorts - turns out it is a hotel (via the bar) after all and we were then greeted warmly by the hotel staff who gave us a bit of history on the way to our room. The hotel is designed in the communal fashion it used to be used as historically which means the rooms face into a courtyard area. Unfortunately this meant we had a slightly small room and no window. Despite this, the room's standard of cleanliness, the toiletries and decor were excellent. Just a note to those sharing a room, the bathroom is all glass...and although frosted for the main part, not particularly sound proof. The location of the hotel is perfect; near lots of great eating places and shops and only a few minutes walk to La Latina underground station and around 7mins to walk to Sol station via Plaza Mayor which is a great square to be near. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: JasmineHolidays
Reviews.Content: Plus points: Location brilliant - right in the centre, short stroll to Plaza Major, loads of Tapas places right outside, 3 mins walk from Metro. Staff: Very friendly indeed and super helpful - everyone, couldn't fault them. Rooms: Bright, modern, funky, great little bathroom with rainforest shower. Satellite tv. Bed was super comfy with memory foam pillows. Rooms come in a few different styles but they all look pretty nice - just different design. Food: Breakfast nice and coffee very good. Minus Points: Noise: Room on the first floor was noisy in the afternoon and late in the evening. The noise from the courtyard echoes right up the central area of the hotel. this was the only negative thing really - to be honest it wasn't really an issue for me but if you're sensative to noise, bear it mind. Room: The rooms aren't large. The design is nice but if space is a premium - bear it in mind. Personally I found the room large enough. Overall really liked staying here - was pleasantly surprised by the value. Would have been 5 out of 5 but for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean but no window”
Reviews.Author: roomservice99
Reviews.Content: Like: - very modern and stylish interior - no carpets therefore very clean - comfortable bed - shower - location is good Dislike: - no window to the outside - the only mirror was a bit small and lights around it not ideal to look at yourself - I experienced some noise from people having drinks in the court in the early evening (therefore hard to have siesta before going out later) I enjoyed my stay. I recommend it to young travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sue O
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Madrid and we were really delighted with this hotel. We were given a complimentary drink when we arrived as reception (which is also the bar) was very busy. This was a nice touch. Very comfy beds, power shower and fluffy towels - all in a modern, rather quirky renovation of an old building. Staff were all delightful and helpful : food was excellent, both breakfast and tapas. All this is in the centre of a vibrant, characterful street full of restaurants and bars and within easy distance of most of the sights of Madrid. Would definitely recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: SanctaSimplicita
Reviews.Content: Overall - very pleased with the hotel and would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Madrid. Positives: - Location is hard to beat - you can walk to most attractions (Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, Palacio Real), and Tirso de Molina metro station is apprx 5-minute walk away if you want to travel to further destinations. Atocha metro station (railway station) is only two stops away. - Staff are very enthusiastic and friendly (thanks to Chemo for his recommendations for our upcoming trip to Barcelona!) - The hotel is located in an old posada (inn) that has been renovated and opened as a modern hotel less than a year ago. The area where hotel is situated and the hotel itself have lots of character. Each room has its own style - different to traditional hotels, a bit funky and modern, with its own personality. -The rooms are a bit minimalistic and on a smaller side, but very clean and had everything we needed including a safe. -The bar downstairs has good food and drinks at reasonable prices. On the negative side: - the room is fine for a couple, but not so good for friends as bathroom doors are semi transparent not giving 100% privacy. - we had room with a balcony, facing Cava Baja (street with many great tapas bars) and it did get noisy on the week-end nights but it seemed to be a lot quieter during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, lovely service,”
Reviews.Author: Sullivans_4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our children aged 13 and 11 for four nights in February and would thoroughly recommend the hotel. The location is perfect - close to the Plaza Mayor, within walking distance of the art galleries and Royal Palace and on a street with plenty of excellent restaurants - and yet wonderfully quiet rooms. Breakfast was good - freshly baked croissants, pains aux raisins, yoghourts, fruit salad, freshly squeezed orange juice, fantastic coffee and hot chocolate for the children. There was also a cooked breakfast available, lots of fresh bread and preserves and delicious Spanish omelette if you had room. The rooms were funky in design - not huge, but with excellent showers, room safe etc. and comfortable memory foam mattresses. The hotel also has a lovely restaurant/tapas bar frequented by Madrilenos so you feel part of the place very quickly. Service was delightful - this is a new hotel run by enthusiastic and happy staff and deserves to do really well!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but not for us”
Reviews.Author: frantica
Reviews.Content: I don't want to give this property bad comments because it is a good choice for people who want to be in the heart of the party neighborhood. We did not know Madrid when we chose this hotel and as more mature travelers we would have preferred a less crowded area. Many would like the hotel and its rooms, which are small but minimalist and trendy in design. Again, we would have preferred a larger room with more traditional furnishings and comfort. For example, the room was so small that there was really nowhere to be except in or on the bed. In our case, the door to the room opened directly into the bathroom (strange). On the plus side the shower was great. Also, the prices for food and drinks in this area is considerably higher than other parts of the city; however, most of central Madrid is easily reachable within a maximum 20 minute walk or from multiple metro stops. The hotel staff was welcoming and friendly. Check-in (and the "front desk") is in a bar on the ground floor which can get noisy and crowded. There is no lobby for hotel guests, and it can be disorienting and annoying to have to navigate a crowded bar to check in or get to your room. Also, noise from the bar could be an issue due to an open central courtyard off of which all rooms open, and I would imagine that rooms on the front (street side) would get a lot of noise at night from the street. Despite my negative observations this is a very nice place for what it is. It just wasn't ideal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent acccommodation in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Zaidhimself
Reviews.Content: I was only in Madrid for one day so didn't spend too much time in the hotel, but the facilities in the room were great - a delightfully comfortable bed, great rain shower and awesome tapas bar downstairs with delightful food. The waiters downstairs were awesome in recommending places with the San Miguel Market just down the road which was pretty nice and the Puerto del Sol Plaza Mayor a mere 5 minutes walk away. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a decent spot in the heart of madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilviaandChris
Reviews.Content: I would recommend it to anyone travelling as a couple or alone. It is a beautifully decorated hotel, with a lot of history around its walls, very clean and taken care of. It was a great experience, in a fantastic area and very helpful staff. The food from the bar is really good as well. On top of that, it is very close to La Plaza Mayor and the main attractions in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “What a find....”
Reviews.Author: BarossaPen
Reviews.Content: What a find in Madrid - Posada del Dragon is a seductive, fun, combination of very good bed, great breakfast, affordable, and amazing location - executed by a team of slick professional staff. The location is in the heart of Madrid's tapas laneways only minutes walk from just about anything. An unconventional but very cool reception is the buzzing bar - and immediately we were right where we wanted to be in Madrid. Exceptional tapas with a contemporary take, good wine list, an immensely (and justifiably) popular bar is the front for very comfortable rooms. Considerately, the doors between the hotel and bar do close at midnight to afford some peace for the residents (if they are there). And the only slight compromise you need to make is - do I take the quiet rooms, with no windows (not right for fresh air fiends) - or, the larger rooms with fresh air and balcony and accept that I'll hear Madrid party into the early hours (or the bottle collection on Monday morning). WiFi is good, housekeeping great, and overall atmosphere just fantastic.... will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Madrid 5 Barcelona 1”
Reviews.Author: ElToffeeChico
Reviews.Content: Posada del Dragon is a very modern approach to the weekend break - but it worked for me! It is in a terrific location in La Latina district, 7-8 minutes from Sol Metro, 5 minutes from Tirso de Molina Metro and less than 5 minutes from the fabulous Plaza Mayor. If you want location you can't beat this place. Do check out the Mercado San Miguel just up the street too. A really good and safe place to try a wide range of tapas and drinks in a safe environment. A good place to start if you need to build your confidence before trying the bars and restaurants elsewhere. The street on which the hotel resides - Calle Cava Baja - was full to bursting on the weekend we stayed in Madrid . But the atmosphere was great, no hint of tension or binge drinking and enough range of bars to serve the young crowd and those of us a little more mature. The hotel itself doubles up as a tapas bar and I can see why some people can feel a little intimidated if you return to the hotel before midnight and expect to go quietly to your bed. This isn't the place for that type of break be warned. We loved it, however, and as we were in Madrid for culture and pleasure we were not in bed before 2.00 a.m. (still early by Madrid standards). Like the rest of my party I was in a single room. Fairly small and basic for a four star hotel it has to be said, but everything worked. TV with wide range of channels, super comfortable bed, decent storage and mini-bar. The highlight, however, was the rainbow shower which was exceptional. Didn't try breakfast but did use the bar and this was a very nice place. Newspapers are on hand in the bar/reception area if you are waiting for your friends to rise from their respective beds. Posada del Dragon is good hotel in a fine city. Madrid is a cultural and culinary delight with lovely people and not like a capital city. I stayed in Barcelona last year and it knocks spots off that place. My marks are high because this contributed to our strong connection to the hotel. It gets 5 out of 5 for me. I gave my hotel and stay in the capital of Catalonia a 1. I guess that makes it Madrid 5 Barcelona 1?

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Fabulous500
Reviews.Content: We had the weekend in Madrid earlier this month and we stayed at Posada del Dragon. It is in a great location in the heart of the old city and on a street that has dozens of tapas bars. In fact the lobby of the hotel is a tapas bar too. It is popular with locals and was really busy when we arrived off a flight from London at 9pm on a Friday night. We had to weave our way through the crowd to check in and were then shown to our rooms. The smaller rooms are gathered around a central courtyard and some of them are tiny and with only internal doors and glass walls - meaning that you cannot have fresh air. My single companions had two of these little rooms, while my sister and I shared a balcony room at the front of the hotel. This was bigger and had the benefit of external windows but yikes was it noisy. As you probably know Madrid parties all night and so with the window open we were intermittently woken by revellers and garbage collectors all night. We didn’t mind but others might – so you need to choose between a bigger room and fresh air, or air-conditioning and a smaller internal room. All the rooms have very cool and clever décor, themed around bright colours and startling shapes, glossy white headboards and nifty cupboards. The showers were EXCELLENT, the bed supremely comfortable and the breakfast was probably the best I have had in Europe. The breakfast room has a bar offering a great selection of savoury and sweet breads & pastries as well as eggs (cooked to order), great coffee, fresh orange juice, a delicious egg tortilla and fruit, yoghurt etc. We ate in the tapas bar too – on the night of our arrival. A table was available so we sat and enjoyed the really vibrant atmosphere and surrounds of this beautiful building. The mojitos were great, so was the red wine and the olives were the best olives any of us have ever eaten in the world – big call but it is true. They were delicious, as were the crocquetas and plump mussels and white anchovies.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Globe_trot_a_lot
Reviews.Content: The price is fair for what it is and the location helps put more charm into the character of the hotel. The electricity had some odd tendencies with the lights; but nothing too annoying. The staff is amazing and customer service is really good. Easy walk to La Latina or Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Best choise in centre Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gdefijter
Reviews.Content: Brand new pousada in tapas straat Cava Baja. Nice food, great service top location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, close to the citycentre.”
Reviews.Author: nicecharsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite new, the staff is nice though. The room we stayed in was a bit small but the rainshower made it more then worth it. The location is excellent, a ten minute stroll to the Plaza Mayor, that includes shopping on the way there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Val12345
Reviews.Content: funky rooms, friendly staff, cool bar at the ground floor (but the rooms were very quiet), spotlessly clean, great shower

Reviews.Title: “positive surprised”
Reviews.Author: vw86
Reviews.Content: what a great weekend in a very comfortable and extrem friendly services, nice and delicious restaurant, creative food, relaxed atmosphare in the bar area, the hotel are in the middle of the city, nearest to the plaza major, if i come back to madrid, i already know i will stay...... at the posada del dragon!
